values:
More more more give me more need more slurp

<lj-cut text="Interpol">

Did anyone read the NY Times piece on Interpol? On how they're all grown up? 

1) REST MY CHEMISTRY

I need to find a new young boyfriend so we can break up and I can listen to this song on loop until I jump off my 27th floor balcony. I already have a 22-year old candidate who is impossibly tall and skinny who already dresses like he should be in Interpol. Like a daisy in my lazy eye...

<lj-embed id="2" />

2) ALL FIRED UP

I need songs to strut through various airport terminals to... this one'll do nicely. I've got this soul. It's all fired up. So many airports this summer. So much strutting. So much soul. You're all mine.

<lj-embed id="3" />

3) SCALE

I shall read on my balcony in the evening-time while listening to this song. I will look into the distance at the stormy sky (there's ALWAYS lightening somewhere it seems these days on the plains) and feel nice at the top of the world.

<lj-embed id="4" />">

</lj-cut>

... the melancholy roar. 

It's coming across the prairie and will surely devour us all. 

It has only begun to devour me and I fear that 2007 will be much like 2004 was. 

At first I will hate it and I will moan. I will make vain attempts to cast it away but by the time the cold and grey of the Minneapolis winter sets in, it will be all over. This is part of their genius, perhaps...? Release a record in summer so we can all discount it and hate on it for the first few months but when we find ourselves too lazy and melancholy to leave the house come September/October, we put it on the old hi-fi and realise that we, from that point forward, will listen to nothing else.

I shall listen to NOTHING ELSE.

Behold! THE NEW INTERPOL RECORD WILL KILL US ALL!

(P.S. I like getting killed)

<lj-embed id="1" />

I moved to this fucking city in the middle of the Midwest expecting snow and we haven't had a flake.

NOT ONE FLAKE.

It MIGHT snow in time for Christmas but it's looking doubtful.

It's just cold and no snow.

Actually today the sun is out and it's kinda nice. I'm wearing shorts in the backyard.

Well, I'm packing it in and moving the little beast (that would be Saydee) and myself down to Los Angeles to spend the holidays with my family... We're doing Xmas in America for the first time in a decade or so and I miss them terribly so I reckon a month with them in the warm weather couldn't be such a bad thing. So.... Thanksgiving and Xmas in Beverly Hills... and then New Year's in New York! With a hopeful move back to London come early 2007! These are the plans! I will probably try to throw together some small going away drinks or tea party. As of now, estimated departure date is around November 16th. And if anyone wants to accompany Saydee and myself down the coast (we'll be stopping in PDX and SFO), let's chat. Road trips are fun!

Is anyone interested in joining me to go see Jandek tonight at OTB? He's enigmatic, has put out 40+ albums, only started playing out last year, blah blah blee blee. Big deal. Should be fun. And we can do whisky shots in the lobby when it becomes tedious. Anyone down?

holy shit i am in osaka and this keyboard is way too confusing. this is my hotel and i am on the 34th floor (!).


flight was fab.

mum:s ignorace continues to be endearing.

i love asia and am now going clubbing.... with my arm in a sling and my devil-may-care attitude, i better score me some japanese nanny.

I'm still in a fairly tremendous amount of pain. Case en point... I slept a grand total of 25 minutes last night because I could not find a comfortable position whatsoever. Even hopped up on Percocet, there is extraordinarily little relief. Now I'm back at work and I must admit that the one good thing about this injury (if you can call it a "good thing") is that I've realised there are far more important things in this world than freaking out about stupid shit like work. No more panicking, no more bullshit office politics, no more idiots at work driving me mental. I just don't give a fuck.

Here are two thoughts that make me happy:

1) Fuck all the hates. I like her hair. I like EVERYTHING she does. I can not stop thinking about her! Agh! Paris was the best night ever!


2) I will be here in one week's time:


That is all.

.... is the most awesome show I've seen in along time.

I've just watched 44 episodes (they're hour-longs) in a row and I can't deal with having to wait until October 3rd for the new season premiere.

And the character known as "The Beav" just got super-hot all of a sudden.

And I'm completely in love with Logan.

Kristen Bell is perhaps the finest young actress of our generation.

Next stop: ALIAS marathon! 24 marathon! Nip/Tuck marathon!

My life is super-awesome.

I also prefer Percocet to Vicodin. 

My shit still hurts. A lot.

I was the victim of a hit and run on Tuesday evening as I was coming home from work. A crazy cracked out man drove through a red light, ACCELERATED and smashed right into my car door. I looked him in the eyes just before we collided. He made no effort to stop.

My car spun on two wheels and slammed down on the curb. Said man ran from the scene ON FOOT. I got out of the car and collapsed to the ground. Hysterical in tears and shock, a battalion of large housewives came to my aid and rang 911. The man who hit me was driving a stolen car and has yet to be found.

I've fractured my collarbone (see below) and bruised my elbow. I'm forbidden from working or doing much of anything for the next two weeks. My mum is flying in and moving in to The Sorrento to nurse me/drive me fucking batty. And the pain... well, the pain is truly fantastic. I don't have words to describe how wretched I feel.

Everyone says "At least you have the painkillers!" Well, the "painkillers" really only make me drowsy... so I nod off... only to be woken up by the pain only a few minutes later.

I should also probably mention that Wednesday was my 27th birthday... which I spent in the E.R. surrounded by Kim, Corey and Corey's boyfriend (who is a lovely nurse... but a stranger nonetheless who cleaned up my vomit and saw me cry).

This has truly been a miserable week. Nice to have all my friends and colleagues come out of the woodwork to bring me things and offer help... but please PLEASE stop bringing me food. I have more cookies, cakes and sushi than any one man should.

I'm a fat cripple in constant pain. And my MOTHER lands at 7:30pm.

Is the final straw? Is it time for me to leave Seattle?

R.I.P.
Astrid Varnay
(1918 - 2006)


She could peel the paint off the walls... and I mean that in the nicest most transcendental kind of way.



Paris was glorious.
London is home.
Opera is my life.
Major re-evaluation is underway.

More on this later.

My life has been so shit lately that I decided to just go to fucking Paris to go see fucking Madonna.

So I'm sick and on the antibiotics and I feel like hell. I watched ALL of last season's 24 yesterday in my convalescence... and holy schneikes, I'm obsessed with the programme now. I've now downloaded all of Season 1 onto the IPod and plan to spend every free minute I have watching it until I've SEEN THEM ALL!

Kiefer Sutherland is kind of a tool, yes, but there's so much drama! When do they sleep? So many twists and turns! Julian Sands! Yagh!

Tonight, I have to buck up and host this panel lecture at the museum... it's kind of interesting really. Come check it out if you like... there are a few seats left!

What sparks creativity?
A presentation and panel discussion on three landmark artists in the fields of fine art, popular music and science fiction.

Ann Powers, Chief Pop Music Critic, Los Angeles Times, presenting on Tori Amos
Greg Bear, World-renowned Science Fiction Author & Chair, SFM Advisory Board, presenting on Ray Bradbury 
Michael Klein, Former Director, Microsoft Art Collection & Former Director, International Sculpture Center, presenting on Beverly Semmes 

Moderated by Bob Santelli, Artistic Director, EMP/SFM.

Date: Thursday, July 13, 2006
Time: 7:00 p.m.
Location: JBL Theater
Admission: Free!

The DoubleTake gallery will be open until 10pm this evening. Admission is FREE to EMP/SFM members, $4 to TakeFive partner members (SAM, TAM, Henry, The Frye) and $8 to the public.

This is tonight... and I kinda expect it to fill up so get there early for your seat! Free! And I'm hosting so come down and represent! LETS ROCK AGAIN! LET'S ROCK AGAIN is an intimate and fascinating portrait of JOE STRUMMER -- the undisputed pioneer of punk and legendary frontman for The Clash. Directed by filmmaker and long-time Strummer friend Dick Rude, LETS ROCK AGAIN! provides an insiders view including touching personal interviews, revealing backstage footage shot in the 18 months leading up to Strummers death in 2002. The film begins with a montage of Strummers illustrious start as frontman for the iconic punk band The Clash and moves into his life years later as the documentary hits the road with Strummers new band The Mescaleros. After the film, we will also screen Dicks documentary on the first 5 years of LA Punk, XEROX BABIES. Dick will also be there in person to answer your questions and grace your presence with his general awesomeness. Come kick it with an LA legend and see what he has to say about a ROCK GOD. Wednesday, July 5th, 2006 7:30pm JBL Theater @ EMP 325 5th Ave N FREE, BITCHES! (Please do not misconstrue this to mean: FREE ONLY TO BITCHES... but bitches be allowed. And they get in for free.)

I'm watching Al Gore on The Daily Show right now... He's wearing all black. He's articulate (with an adorable little Tennessee accent). He's droll. He's animated. He's so fucking hot it makes me sick. Wasn't he supposed to be president? I mean... RIGHT? And I loved the film. Loved. Sigh.

So I recently had my hair did and the stylist flat-ironed my hair and so help me, I looked like Madonna and I loved it. Now I want to get one of my very own but am confused as to why some cost as low as 25$ and some can run up a few hundred dollars.

The blow drying just ain't cutting it. The flips are too strong. 

Can anyone recommend a brand/model?

Too gay?

George Carlin's 16 New Rules for 2006
 
New Rule ..1: Stop giving me that pop-up ad for classmates.com!
There's a reason you don't talk to people for 25 years. Because you
don't particularly like them! Besides, I already know what the captain of
the football team is doing these days: mowing my lawn.
 
New Rule ..2: Don't eat anything that's served to you out a window
unless you're a seagull. People are acting all shocked that a human
finger was found in a bowl of Wendy's chili. Hey, it cost less than a
dollar. What did you expect it to contain? Trout?
 
New Rule ..3: Stop saying that teenage boys who have sex with their
hot, blonde teachers are permanently damaged. I have a better
description for these kids: lucky bastards.
 
New Rule ..4: If you need to shave and you still collect baseball
cards, you're a dope. If you're a kid, the cards are keepsakes of
your idols. If you're a grown man, they're pictures of men.
 
New Rule ..5: Ladies, leave your eyebrows alone. Here's how much men
care about your eyebrows: do you have two of them? Okay, we're done.
 
New Rule ..6: There's no such thing as flavored water. There's a
whole aisle of this crap at the supermarket... water, but without
that watery taste.
Sorry, but flavored water is called a soft drink. You want flavored
water? Pour some scotch over ice and let it melt. That should be your
flavored
water.
 
New Rule ..7: Stop f***ing with old people. Target is introducing a
redesigned pill bottle that's square, with a bigger label. And the top
is now the bottom. And by the time grandpa figures out how to open
it, his ass will be in the morgue. Congratulations, Target, you just
solved the Social Security crisis.
 
New Rule ..8: The more complicated the Starbucks order, the bigger
the asshole. If you walk into a Starbucks and order a "decaf grande
half-soy,half-low fat, iced vanilla, double-shot, gingerbread cappuccino,
extra dry, light ice, with one Sweet-n'-Low and one NutraSweet," ooh,
you're a huge asshole.
 
New Rule ..9: I'm not the cashier! By the time I look up from sliding
my card, entering my PIN number, pressing "Enter," verifying the amount,
deciding, "No, I don't want cash back", and pressing "Enter" again,
the kid who is supposed to be ringing me up is standing there eating my
Almond Joy.
 
New Rule ..10: Just because your tattoo has Chinese characters in it
doesn't make you spiritual. It's right above the crack of your ass.
And it translates to "beef with broccoli." The last time you did anything
spiritual, you were praying to God you weren't pregnant. You're not
spiritual. You're just high.
 
New Rule ..11: Competitive eating isn't a sport. It's one of the
seven deadly sins. ESPN recently televised the US Open of Competitive
Eating, because watching those athletes at the poker table was just too
damned exciting. What's next, competitive farting? Oh wait. They're
Already doing that. It's called "The Howard Stern Show."
 
New Rule ..12: I don't need a bigger mega M&M. If I'm extra hungry
for M&Ms, I'll go nuts and eat two.
 
New Rule ..13: If you're going to insist on making movies based on
crappy, old television shows, then you have to give everyone in the
Cineplex a remote so we can see what's playing on the other screens. Let's
remember the reason something was a television show in the first
place is that the idea wasn't good enough to be a movie.
 
New Rule ..14: No more gift registries. You know, it used to be just
for weddings. Now it's for babies and new homes and graduations from
rehab. Picking out the stuff you want and having other people buy it for you
isn't gift giving, it's the white people version of looting.
 
New Rule ..15: and this one is long overdue: No more bathroom
attendants. After I zip up, some guy is offering me a towel and a mint,
as if I just had sex with George Michael. I can't even tell if he's
supposed to be there, or just some freak with a fetish. I don't want to
be on your webcam, dude. I just want to wash my hands.
 
New Rule ..16: When I ask how old your toddler is, I don't need to
know in months. "27 Months?" "He's two," will do just fine. He's not a
cheese. And I didn't really care in the first place. I was attempting
to be nice.

So yes. Madonna's concert was not only the greatest one of her career... it was very possibly the greatest concert I've ever been to. She worked HARD for that ticket price and bless her, she earned every penny. Still too shocked to really discuss it. San Jose, however, is the arsehole of the world. I hope never to return.

Whirlwind weekend. San Francisco is radical. Some bulletpoints as I am too hungover to think in any other fashion.

* Mogwai was a blisteringly good show and the contact high from all the stoners around us only enhanced the experience.

* Jennifer is the greatest thing in the world. 

* Nadine is also the greatest thing in the world with the most comfortable bed on the planet that I have YET to move from today.

* San Francisco is beautiful. The boys are cute and aplenty. And all cute people want to do here is LAY IN THE PARK.

* We spent all day Sunday and a good portion yesterday laying in Dolores Park. There is a man who walks around with these buckets selling mystery food to parklovers. Nadine and I clapped and thought they might be dim sum... but oh no... wait for it... they were WEED TRUFFLES. In SIX different flavours! I got a cinnamon, a coconut and a ginger pecan. Normal human people need only eat half of one. In my traiditonal gluttonous manor, I ate THREE. I have never been so stoned in my life. Jennifer walked me all around San Francisco in the hopes that I would "come down." No such luck. We rented movies but as soon as "Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" came on to the screen, I got way too confused and panicky. TOO STONED.

* Yesterday involved additional recovery from the too-stoned-ness. TOO STONED! We went to the beach and I fell in love with love and decided I need to go to the beach OFTEN. Then more drinking of the white wine in Dolores Park with a gaggle of hipsters. DO THEY EVEN HAVE POLICE HERE? I ATE MARIJUANA AND DRANK ALCOHOL IN PUBLIC. There was also croquet. 

* Went to Nadine's club night. Got way too drunk. Woke up in underpants spooning Nadine.

* Today I watch telly and prepare myself for MADONNA. Tonight. In San Jose, even! Wheeeeeee!

I need rehabilitation. I also wish I could live my entire life in my underpants.  Nadine's house-mates don't seem to mind.

Back to the bed!!!!!
AND FINALLY OF COURSE

I have a sports injury! My index finger got in the way of a softball during Saturday's games and now it's all schnasty, swollen and black. Looks like it's gonna fall off.

I've been waving it around to anyone and everyone I can pin down. I'm so super-sporty and now I have the injury to prove it.

Awesome.

So I got this new phone (that I'm really hating) and I've lost ALL of my contacts... Could folks e-mail me or ring me or text me with their info?

Bisoux!
c-p

Have a great weekend!

(p.s. YOU NEED TO BE CLICKING ON THAT HOT ACTION RIGHT UP THERE)

I can't believe I will now be breaking the bank (potentially) on not one but TWO concerts. B&S @ The Hollywood Bowl with the LA Philharmonic and now to bloody Phoenix for this shit.

I'm not a fan club member... Can anyone help me get tickets?

Pretty please?

.. If anyone is interested in a part-time gig working with me in External Relations (oh let's see... we work on music, science fiction, Impressionism and Contemporary Art)...

3-4 days a week. It pays decent and will most likely become a full-time salary gig in the next few months. Just feeling out candidates right now and trying to ascertain just how much support I need...

I handle all things PR, CR and GR for EMP, SFM and now... DT.

If you don't know what those acronyms mean... it might be a wrong fit.

Pop me an e-mail at christianq@emplive.org if interested or hit me back here.

I'm a good friend and fun to go out on the piss with... but I'm kind of a crazy boss. You've been warned.

:)

We hosted the Memorial for the remarkable Octavia E. Butler last night at the museum and I had the distinct pleasure of delivering Samuel Delany's eulogy and also reading a passage from my favourite essay of hers (that she wrote on occasion of the 2001 UN Conference on Racism) to close out the speeches. Standing at the podium in front of her 200 family, friends, fans and fellow SF authors (I mean... these are all authors I've been reading since I was a kid) I, by some miracle, didn't burst out into tears... I was pretty much the only one who didn't. When I got back to my seat and Vonda McIntyre read, however, I lost my shit. It was a lovely evening in rememberance of a formidable woman and great American mind. It was nice to be inspired and sit in an audience of so many different types of people... black, white, straight, gay, young, old... and celebrate the work and inspiration of a woman who spoke not only for other black women... but for the disenfranchised everywhere. Octavia Butler, for me at least, epitomised the American experience and was/is a truly exceptional and key American voice not only in the sci-fi canon... but in that of American literature on the whole. She gave a voice to generations of people who dared to dream of the way life should be... and who dared to admit how frightened they were of how it most likely will turn out. You can read about the night's activities and get some other great highlights in the extended features written in both The Seattle Times (out today... cover of LOCAL section) and Seattle Post-Intelligencer (coming out tomorrow). If anyone wonders where to start if they'd like to read Ms. Butler... I suggest starting with her short story Bloodchild or her novel Kindred or even delving in to the great Patternist series (which starts, in the order it was meant to be read at least, with Wild Seed ).

OCTAVIA ESTELLE BUTLER


1947 - 2006


REST IN PEACE

COSI FAN TUTTE = BITCHES BE LIKE THIS Hos are hos and they can't be trusted. This Jonathan Miller (Sir to YOU, buddy!) production should not be missed. Even if you hate it... which many will... it's Mozart's best. Sez me, at least. It's funny, relevant and set in the present day. It's about two guys who don't trust their girlfriends so they fuck around with them but (arguably) end up getting fucked themselves in the end. It's fairly disturbing, actually... but you'll laugh. I have an extra ticket for March 10th if anyone wants to join. I got half off the ticket and they're the best seats in the house.

I woke up to this from my Mum: I hate Valentine's Day. Only really ever had one once... My first boyfriend ever that I lived with back in Oxford. I miss him lots. But it would appear that I have a Valentine this year and we're going to go see this tonight! Ralph Fiennes will always and forever be my greatest valentine. Last night I stayed in, cleared out some Tivo (You know what show is officially DONE, by the way? Desperate Housewives. Stick in the fork and all that business.), ate some roast chicken, drank some of my Cote-du-Rhone, snuggled by the fireplace with Mme. LaSaydee and then went to sleep in my brand new sheets. I want to do that EVERY NIGHT. Work is annoying today.
